error_message.description: Message shown if something goes wrong

no_response_text.title: No Response Message

no_documents_message.title: No Documents Message

no_documents_message.default: No documents have been uploaded yet. Please upload documents in the admin panel to enable document-based answers.

ai_settings.title: AI Behavior
ai_settings.description: Control how the AI responds to questions

system_prompt.title: AI Instructions
system_prompt.description: These instructions tell the AI how to behave when answering questions. You can customize this to change the AI's tone, style, and what information it prioritizes.
system_prompt.default: You are a helpful, friendly assistant that answers questions based on the provided document context. When answering, use the information from the documents when available. If the answer is not in the documents, say so clearly and provide a general response based on your knowledge.

secondary_color.title: Accent Color
secondary_color.description: A secondary color used for highlights and less important elements

text_color.title: Text Color

app_settings.ui:help: Start by giving your chatbot a name and description

app_title.ui:help: This will be displayed at the top of your chatbot

app_description.ui:help: A brief explanation of what your chatbot does

documents.ui:help: Upload files in supported formats to enable document-based answers

file_upload.ui:help: Upload files in supported formats to enable document-based answers

content.ui:help: Customize the text that appears in your chatbot interface

content_title.ui:help: This heading appears at the top of the chat area and helps users understand the purpose of the chatbot.

welcome_message.ui:help: This is the first message users will see when they open the chatbot. It should be friendly and explain what the chatbot can help with.

input_placeholder.ui:help: This text appears in the empty input field to guide users on what to type.

send_button_text.ui:help: The text on the button that sends the user's message. Usually 'Send' or 'Ask'.

typing_indicator_text.ui:help: Text shown while the AI is generating a response. Indicates to users that the system is working.

error_message.ui:help: Message shown if there's a technical error. Should be clear but not too technical.

no_response_text.ui:help: Message shown if the AI doesn't provide a response. Encourages users to try again.

no_documents_message.ui:help: Message shown when no documents have been uploaded. Guides users on what to do next.

quick_actions.ui:help: Create clickable question buttons to help users get started

quick_action1.ui:help: This question helps users discover the main topics or themes in their documents. Good for initial exploration.

quick_action2.ui:help: This question prompts the AI to provide a concise summary of the key points from all documents.

quick_action3.ui:help: This template encourages users to search for specific information by completing the phrase (e.g., 'Find information about pricing').

quick_action4.ui:help: This template helps users compare different concepts or topics found in their documents.

quick_action5.ui:help: This template allows users to ask for explanations of specific concepts mentioned in their documents.

ai_settings.ui:help: Control how the AI responds to questions

system_prompt.ui:help: These instructions tell the AI how to behave - you can customize the tone and style

styling.ui:help: Customize colors, fonts, and other visual elements

primary_color.ui:help: This color is used for buttons, user message bubbles, and the header. Choose a color that matches your brand.

secondary_color.ui:help: This color is used for hover states and secondary elements. It should complement your primary color.

background_color.ui:help: The main background color of the chatbot interface. Lighter colors are recommended for better readability.

text_color.ui:help: The color of the main text in your chatbot. Should have good contrast with the background color.

light_bg_color.ui:help: The background color for AI message bubbles. Should be light enough for text to be readable.

border_color.ui:help: The color of borders between elements. Usually a light gray for subtle separation.

font_family.ui:help: The font used throughout the chatbot. System fonts ensure consistent display across devices.

font_size_small.ui:help: Size for smaller text elements like quick action buttons. Usually 12-14px.

font_size_medium.ui:help: Size for most text elements including chat messages. Usually 16px for good readability.

font_size_large.ui:help: Size for headings and important text. Usually 20-24px.

border_radius.ui:help: Controls how rounded the corners of elements are. Higher values (8-12px) give a more modern look.
